name: SaaS - Next.js + Convex Stack
description: Full-stack SaaS template with real-time capabilities, authentication, and payments
useCase: B2B/B2C SaaS products requiring real-time updates, user authentication, and subscription billing

frontend.reasoning: Next.js 16 App Router provides server components, streaming, and excellent SEO. Tailwind v4 offers zero-config setup. shadcn/ui gives production-ready, accessible components.

backend.reasoning: Convex eliminates boilerplate with built-in real-time, auth, file storage, and deployment. Zero-config local dev. Scales automatically.

auth.reasoning: Clerk provides production-ready auth with organizations, webhooks, and excellent DX. Integrates seamlessly with Next.js and Convex.

payments.reasoning: Stripe is the gold standard for payments. Excellent docs, webhooks, and customer portal. Works globally.

deployment.reasoning: Vercel is built by Next.js creators. Zero-config deployment, edge network, automatic HTTPS, and preview URLs.

monitoring.reasoning: Sentry catches errors before users report them. PostHog provides product analytics and feature flags.

ai.reasoning: AI SDK abstracts model differences with streaming, function calling, and edge runtime support.

pros: Real-time out of the box (no WebSocket setup)
Fast to MVP (3-6 hours with AI team)
cons: Vendor lock-in (Convex is proprietary, though data export available)
Learning curve (Convex patterns different from REST/GraphQL)
Costs scale with usage (free tier generous but can grow)

alternatives.name: Next.js + Supabase
alternatives.whenToChoose: Need PostgreSQL, open-source preference, or existing SQL skills
alternatives.tradeoffs: More setup, manual real-time configuration, but more control

alternatives.name: Next.js + Firebase
alternatives.whenToChoose: Mobile app integration, Google Cloud ecosystem
alternatives.tradeoffs: NoSQL limitations, vendor lock-in to Google

alternatives.name: Next.js + Prisma + Planetscale
alternatives.whenToChoose: Need full SQL control, complex queries
alternatives.tradeoffs: No built-in real-time, more DevOps overhead

examples.name: Notion
examples.stackFit: Perfect - real-time editing, user management, subscriptions
